title: Watch: Pat Cummins returns to nets ahead of Border Gavaskar Trophy
body:
Pat Cummins has returned to the nets as the Australia captain stepped up his preparations for the Border Gavaskar Trophy, which will begin in November. Cummins has been on a break from the national team after being a part of the T20 World Cup 2024 squad and also participating in the Major League Cricket. Cummins is not part of the Australia squad that is currently touring England at the moment.

advertisement

The Australian skipper has now posted a video on his official Instagram profile, showing him back in the nets and going full tilt. Cummins looked to be in fine form while rolling his arm over. The Aussie skipper said that he was getting ready for a huge summer and expressed his excitement being back in the nets.

"Getting ready for a huge summer. First few bowls back after a pre-season break. let’s gooooo!" read the caption from Cummins.

Cummins aiming to keep Rishabh Pant silent in BGT

Cummins has highlighted Rishabh Pant as a key focus ahead of the upcoming Border Gavaskar Trophy. In an interview with Star Sports, Cummins emphasized that Pant is a game-changer, capable of taking control of the match, and stressed the importance of Australia being prepared for the Indian wicketkeeper-batter ahead of the five-match Test series.

advertisement

"Every team has one or two of those players who take the game on. Australia have Travis Head and Mitchell Marsh. I think those guys, you know that they are going to be aggressive, take the game on. Like Rishabh Pant might play a reverse slap and it is an incredible shot and that's just part of who he is," Cummins said on Star Sports.

"He's someone that has a big influence in a couple of series and we have go to try and keep him quiet," he further added.

India's tour of Australia 2024-25 Schedule

First Test at Perth Stadium in Perth - November 22 to 26

Second Test at Adelaide Oval in Adelaide - December 6 to 10 (Day-Night)

Third Test at The Gabba in Brisbane - December 14 to 18

Fourth Test at the MCG in Melbourne - December 26 to December 30

Fifth Test at the SCG in Sydney - January 3 to January 7, 2025.

Published By:

alan john

Published On:

Sep 25, 2024

title: Pat Cummins Prepares for Big Test Series Against India and Sri Lanka
body:
Australian cricket captain Pat Cummins is getting ready for a busy Test summer. The excitement kicks off with the Border-Gavaskar Trophy against India, starting on November 22 in Perth.

Cummins shared a video on Instagram, showing his intense training. He wrote, “Getting ready for a huge summer. First few bowls back after a pre-season break let’s gooooo!”

After the series against India, Australia will play against Sri Lanka. Cummins recently played in the Major League Cricket in the US, where his team, San Francisco Unicorns, lost the final to Washington Freedom.

In 2023, Cummins had a fantastic year, winning the ICC World Test Championship and ICC Cricket World Cup by defeating India. He also helped Australia retain the Ashes urn in the UK.

With India having won the last two series in their territory, Cummins is eager to lead Australia to a much-needed victory. He plans to play in the Sheffield Shield tournament to prepare for the series against India.

The second Test will be a day-night match at Adelaide Oval from December 6 to 10. The third Test will be at The Gabba in Brisbane from December 14 to 18. The Boxing Day Test will be at Melbourne Cricket Ground from December 26 to 30. The final Test will be at Sydney Cricket Ground from January 3 to 7, promising an exciting conclusion to the series.
